question.text:
Given below is a diagrammatic representation of the female reproductive system.



The main function of the part labelled B is to

options.text: Release ovum from the Graafian follicle
Make necessary changes in the endometrium for implantation
Help in the development of corpus luteum
Help in the collection of the ovum after ovulation

solution.text:
A - ovary
B - fimbrae 
C - uterus
D - fallopian tube

Fallopian tube (oviduct, uterine tube) is either of a pair of tubes that conduct ova (egg cells) from the ovary to the uterus. The ovarian end opens into the abdominal cavity via a funnel-shaped structure with a finger-like projection (fimbriae) surrounding the opening. Movements of the fimbriae at ovulation assist in directing the ovum to the Fallopian tube.
